articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Multiple loud explosions were heard in several places in Pakistan and Pakistani Kashmir on Wednesday as India said it had attacked "terrorist infrastructure" in nine sites and Pakistan vowed to respond to the attacks.
articles.title: India says it attacked nine sites in Pakistan, Pakistani Kashmir

articles.author: Mohammed Ghobari
articles.description: The Israeli military carried out an airstrike on Yemen's main airport in Sanaa on Tuesday, its second attack in two days on Iran-aligned Houthi rebels, after the group launched a missile attack near Israel's Ben Gurion Airport.
articles.title: Israel hits Yemen's main airport in airstrike against Houthis

articles.author: Andrea Shalal, David Lawder, Steve Holland
articles.description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and chief trade negotiator Jamieson Greer will meet China's top economic official He Lifeng in Switzerland this weekend for talks, U.S. and Chinese officials said, in what could be a first step toward resolving a trade war disrupting the global economy.
articles.title: US, Chinese officials to hold ice-breaker meeting in Geneva on Saturday

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia and Ukraine launched overnight air attacks on each other's capitals on Wednesday, with swarms of drones destroyed on their approach to Moscow and Russian missiles and drones sparking fires in several apartments in Kyiv.
articles.title: Russia, Ukraine launch air attacks on each other's capitals

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: India launched strikes on Pakistan and Pakistani Kashmir on Wednesday, an assault Pakistan has called a "blatant act of war" as tensions escalate between the arch rivals after a deadly attack on tourists in Indian Kashmir.
articles.title: What happened in India's attack on Pakistan over Kashmir tourists killings?

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Explosions were heard in the Sudanese city of Port Sudan early on Wednesday, a Reuters witness reported, adding that the Sudanese army launched anti-aircraft missiles.
articles.title: Explosions heard in Port Sudan, army launched anti-aircraft missiles, Reuters witness says

articles.author: Wa Lone, Poppy Mcpherson, Shoon Naing
articles.description: Burmese academic Sophia Htwe spent hours desperately trying to call home from Australia after the 7.7 magnitude earthquake struck her hometown in Myanmar in late March, learning that a childhood friend had been trapped in the rubble.
articles.title: Few doctors, throttled aid: How Myanmar’s junta worsened earthquake toll

articles.author: Phil Stewart, Idrees Ali, Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: Reuters could not determine how many migrants would be sent to Libya.
articles.title: Exclusive: U.S. may soon deport migrants to Libya on military flight, sources say

articles.author: Crispian Balmer, Joshua McElwee, Philip Pullella
articles.description: Roman Catholic cardinals will begin the task on Wednesday of electing a new pope, locking themselves away from the world until they choose the man they hope can unite a diverse but divided global Church.
articles.title: Vatican conclave to pick new pope, world waits for white smoke

articles.author: Idrees Ali, Phil Stewart
articles.description: More than 60 service members were injured as a part of former President Joe Biden's floating aid pier in Gaza, a Pentagon Inspector General report published on Tuesday said, a number significantly higher than had been previously disclosed.
articles.title: Biden's Gaza pier injured far more troops than previously known
